abr.desc: Sets the announcementbox text messaging range in pixels, -1 for serverwide announcements.

autoEnableMods.desc: Automatically enables all mods in the mods folder

backups.desc: Sets the number of rolling world backups to keep

difficulty.desc: This can not be changed after the world was generated - Options: 0 - (normal), 1 - (expert), 2 - (master), 3 - (journey)

disableannouncementbox.desc: Disables the text announcements Announcement Box makes when pulsed from wire. - leave blank to let them enabled - or set it to `-disableannouncementbox` to disable it

ip.desc: Sets the IP address for the server to listen on - 0.0.0.0 means every possible IP

lang.desc: Please use the short lang code - English=en-US, German=de-DE, Italian=it-IT, French=fr-FR, Spanish=es-ES, Russian=ru-RU, Chinese=zh-Hans, Portuguese=pt-BR, Polish=pl-PL

motd.desc: Set the message of the day

npcs.desc: Reduces enemy skipping but increases bandwidth usage. The lower the number the less skipping will happen, but more data is sent. 0 is off.

password.desc: Server Password - leave blank for none

port.desc: What port to bind the server to

seed.desc: This can not be changed after the world was generated - Seed of the World

size.desc: This can not be changed after the world was generated - World Size (1-3 - 3 is biggest)

sl.desc: Reduces maximum liquids moving at the same time. If enabled may reduce lags but liquids may take longer to settle.

version.display: tModLoader Version (Set this to the latest tModLoader version - see https://github.com/tModLoader/tModLoader/releases/latest)

install.text:
#!/bin/bash
if [ "$1" == "false" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

enabledMods="["

for file in ./mods/*.tmod; do
  modName="$(basename "$file" .tmod)"
  enabledMods="$enabledMods\n\t\"$modName\","
  echo "$modName"
done

enabledMods="${enabledMods::-1}\n]"
echo -e "Enabled Mods: $enabledMods"
echo -e "$enabledMods" > "mods/enabled.json"
